page.title: 05Pottles Farm
page.content:
We went to Pottles Farm and interviewed the farmer's daughter. We found out that they have got 450 acres of land most of which is grass. They grow corn, maize, lucerne and peas. These crops are rotated every eight years. They use natural and artifical fertilizers. Beef cattle and sheep are kept. The corn is sold to a corn merchant in Exeter and the cattle and sheep are sent to market. The wool is sent to Buckfastliegh and some apples are sold for cider. The farm has four tractors and a lot machinery. A combine harvester is shared with a neighbour.
The family starts work at 7.30am and sometimes work until 9.00pm. In the past the farm was smaller with less machinery and more workers.
